intro: Salacia longipes var. longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled salacia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with long petioles. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by elliptical, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
